1. HUAWEI MatePad Pro 13.2" – most powerful hardware (large OLED 144 Hz display, high‑end chipset, ample RAM/storage, pro accessories).  
2. iPad mini (6th gen) – best small tablet; top‑tier performance, long support, strong app ecosystem.  
3. Google Pixel Tablet – strong SoC, good screen, smart‑home dock, long Android support.  
4. Galaxy Tab S7 FE – big 12.4" display with S Pen support, good mid‑high performance.  
5. Acer Iconia Tab P10 – solid midrange (10.4" 2K, Kompanio 500, 4 GB RAM, 64 GB storage).  
6. LG G Pad IV 8.0 FHD – older but decent 8" FHD, modest performance by today’s standards.  
7. Alcatel 3T10 2020 – entry‑level performance, basic screen and specs.  
8. Chuwi Hipad X Keyboard – accessory, not a tablet; ranked last as it isn’t a standalone device.

2. iPad mini (latest gen on page) – very fast SoC, long support, excellent app ecosystem.  
3. Pixel Tablet – strong performance, clean Android, good display, dock/smart home features.  
4. Galaxy Tab S7 FE – large high‑quality screen, S Pen support, good mid‑range performance.  
5. Acer Iconia Tab P10 – decent 10.4" 2K display, modest Kompanio 500, good battery.  
6. LG G Pad IV 8.0 FHD – older hardware, smaller FHD display, more basic overall.  
7. Alcatel 3T10 2020 – entry‑level performance and features.

Here’s an absolute performance/overall-quality–oriented ranking, best to worst, using only those pages:

1. **HUAWEI MatePad Pro 13.2"** – flagship‑class display, performance, features.  
2. **Samsung Galaxy Tab S7 FE** – strong large‑screen Android tablet, good performance/features.  
3. **Google Pixel Tablet** – solid modern tablet with good integration, but more mid‑range hardware.  
4. **Apple iPad mini** – very capable but smaller display; excellent ecosystem, strong chip.  
5. **Acer Iconia Tab P10** – decent 10" tablet, more value‑focused mid‑range.  
6. **LG G Pad IV 8.0 FHD** – older hardware, smaller FHD screen, more basic.  
7. **Alcatel 3T10 2020** – budget device, clearly lower‑end specs.  
8. **Chuwi HiPad X Keyboard page** – accessory/keyboard page, not a standalone tablet product.

1. Huawei MatePad Pro 13.2" – flagship‑class performance, OLED display, premium build, strong pen/keyboard ecosystem.  
2. Samsung Galaxy Tab S7 FE – large 12.4" display, good performance, S Pen included, strong Android tablet software.  
3. Google Pixel Tablet – solid performance, clean Android with long updates, unique dock/smart display use.  
4. Apple iPad mini – very fast chip in a compact body, best app ecosystem, but small screen vs others.  
5. Acer Iconia Tab P10 – good 10.4" 2K display and decent specs for media and light gaming.  
6. LG G Pad IV 8.0 FHD – older hardware, smaller 8" FHD screen; fine for basics, dated overall.  
7. Alcatel 3T10 2020 – entry‑level 10" tablet, modest specs and performance.  
8. Chuwi HiPad X Keyboard – accessory, not a tablet; only enhances a HiPad X you already own.
